intro: Columnea inaequilatera, commonly known as the unequal-sided flame flower, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with contrasting markings. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Columnea inaequilatera is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
